Set classcodes object

Source: R/set_classcodes.R
set_classcodes.Rd

Set classcodes object

set_classcodes(
  cc,
  classified = NULL,
  regex = NULL,
  start = TRUE,
  stop = FALSE,
  tech_names = FALSE
)

Arguments

cc

classcodes object or name of such
classified

object that classcodes could be inherited from
regex

name of column with regular expressions to use for classification, either with or without prefix regex_. NULL (default) uses the first classcodes column with prefix "regex". This should be a sensible choice for default classcodes object included in the package.
start, stop

should codes start/end with the specified regular expressions? If TRUE, column "regex" is prefixed/suffixed by ^/$.
tech_names

should technical column names be used? If FALSE, colnames are taken directly from group names of by, if TRUE, these are changed to more technical names avoiding special characters and are prefixed by the name of the classification scheme.

Value

classcodes object.

See also

Other classcodes: all_classcodes(), as.data.frame.classified(), classcodes, codebooks(), codebook(), print.summary.classcodes(), summary.classcodes(), visualize.classcodes()

Examples

# Prepare a classcodes object for the Charlson comorbidity classification
# based on the default regular expressions
set_classcodes(charlson)

#> Classification based on: regex_icd10
#> # A tibble: 17 x 9
#>    group description index_charlson index_deyo_rama… index_dhoore index_ghali
#>  * <chr> <chr>                <dbl>            <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl>
#>  1 myoc… Acute myoc…              1                1            1           1
#>  2 cong… Heart fail…              1                1            1           4
#>  3 peri… Peripheral…              1                1            1           2
#>  4 cere… Cerebrovas…              1                1            1           1
#>  5 deme… Senile and…              1                1            1           0
#>  6 chro… Chronic ob…              1                1            1           0
#>  7 rheu… Systemic l…              1                1            1           0
#>  8 pept… Gastric, d…              1                1            1           0
#>  9 mild… Alcoholic …              1                1            1           0
#> 10 diab… Diabetes w…              1                1            1           0
#> 11 hemi… Paraplegia…              2                1            1           0
#> 12 rena… Chronic gl…              2                1            1           3
#> 13 diab… Diabetes w…              2                1            1           0
#> 14 mali… Malignant …              2                1            1           0
#> 15 mode… Hepatic co…              3                1            1           0
#> 16 meta… Secondary …              6                1            1           0
#> 17 AIDS… HIV infect…              6                1            1           0
#> # … with 3 more variables: index_quan_original <dbl>, index_quan_updated <dbl>,
#> #   regex <chr>

# Same as above but based on regular expressions for ICD-8
set_classcodes(charlson, regex = "regex_icd8_brusselaers")

#> # A tibble: 13 x 9
#>    group description index_charlson index_deyo_rama… index_dhoore index_ghali
#>  * <chr> <chr>                <dbl>            <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl>
#>  1 myoc… Acute myoc…              1                1            1           1
#>  2 cong… Heart fail…              1                1            1           4
#>  3 peri… Peripheral…              1                1            1           2
#>  4 cere… Cerebrovas…              1                1            1           1
#>  5 deme… Senile and…              1                1            1           0
#>  6 chro… Chronic ob…              1                1            1           0
#>  7 rheu… Systemic l…              1                1            1           0
#>  8 hemi… Paraplegia…              2                1            1           0
#>  9 rena… Chronic gl…              2                1            1           3
#> 10 diab… Diabetes w…              2                1            1           0
#> 11 mali… Malignant …              2                1            1           0
#> 12 mode… Hepatic co…              3                1            1           0
#> 13 meta… Secondary …              6                1            1           0
#> # … with 3 more variables: index_quan_original <dbl>, index_quan_updated <dbl>,
#> #   regex <chr>
